file_content.text: I like your honesty, friend. You're okay in my book.
I'm picking up some pretty angry chatter on Exchange frequencies. Sounds like you held up your end of our little deal.
There's nothing I admire more than honesty. The Hutt Cartel will keep the Republic at bay. You can count on it.
Bust up those Exchange organ thieves, and we'll talk.
My lord. Skav Mora. Hutt Cartel. Don't often get to deal directly with someone of your stature, but I hope that's about to change.
I know your kind. Real patriot. Tough. Won't take "no" for an answer. I like that. I need that.
Hunter. From the sound of it, you know which way the wind blows in this galaxy. Empire or bust. So let's make a deal.
You look like a smart person. Good Imperial supporter. Let's make a deal.
I'm talking about expanding the mutually beneficial relationship between the Hutt Cartel and the Empire.
Of course. I'm a friend of all Nar Shaddaa's lowlifes.
You've caught my interest.
Not looking for friendship. Know better than to trust a Sith's definition of the word.
You must have a lot of guts to try to cut a deal with a Sith Lord.
Do you know who I am?
The Hutts don't trust their business to just anyone.
The Empire likes to keep the upper hand in all its "mutually beneficial" relationships.
Just remember who's boss.
The Hutt Cartel feels the same way. But in this case, they're willing to accept less favorable terms.
The Empire pays me. I don't owe them anything, and I don't do them favors.
I don't represent the Empire.
And if the Hutt Cartel pays, it's not a favor, is it?
I'm not concerned with Hutts.
The Hutts run this planet. They're very good allies.
I've been on Nar Shaddaa long enough to know I should look for strings before I make any deals.
What's the catch?
Strings? No, there's no strings. Just a little tit for tat.
Seems the Republic's meddling in Imperial business. Spreading rumors of hidden torture facilities to scare the gangs, keep them from working with the Empire.
The Hutt Cartel can make it very... uncomfortable for any gang that works with the Republic. But we need the Empire to scratch our backs in return.
Is this bribery or blackmail, because I don't respond well to either.
Don't twist my arm.
Hey, I didn't mean it that way. I just think we can help each other.
What do you need done?
The Exchange has been messing up our slave shipments, taking the low classes and harvesting organs from them for sale on the black market.
You take care of the organ thieves, and the Hutt Cartel will handle the Empire's little Republic problem.
We have a deal.
I don't have a choice.
Sorry. It's just good business.
Where do I find these thieves?
The Exchange is in the shipyards, getting ready to move the organs offworld.
I want the organ thieves killed, and the organ shipments destroyed. Show them it's bad business crossing the Hutts, and the Empire.
Not a chance. [Refuse quest]
Your choice, but your Empire can't do anything if the Republic starts laying pressure on the gangs. You need us.
Sorry, I don't got time to talk.
